result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jonathen D. Heath not in court.  Prosecuting attorney Vivien L. TenHaken in court for the State of Wisconsin. Letter on file requesting new date. DE in custody. Minutes filed.
Status conference scheduled for November 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Letter from Attorney Pruden

BTC "The 10/26 court date can be reset. The court will decide the motion for sanctions at the time of the disposition of the case" - Judge Johnson
Requesting a reset of 10/26 date - Defense

Defendant Jonathen D. Heath appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Larry R Pruden in court for Jonathen D. Heath.  Prosecuting attorney Samuel Thomas Berg in court for the State of Wisconsin. Case No. 22CF364 to be scheduled for same Status date in October.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor

records.addlTxt:
BOND TO COVER 22CF404 & 22CF364

Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol. Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. Any prescribed medication is to be taken within the terms / limits of the prescription. Defendant will not possess any firearms, ammunition or other weapons. Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH T.S.C. dob 8-9-1980 or H.L.J. dob 10-12-1984 or residences. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.
Scheduling Order will be provided to Attys via e-filing by the Court
Not guilty plea entered and trial reserved.

2:00 PM (64-06) Defendant Jonathen D. Heath appeared by video.  Attorney Samuel Berg in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Larry R Pruden in court for Jonathen D. Heath. 
Matter was scheduled for a preliminary hearing but the defendant wishes to waive his right to a preliminary hearing.  Response by Counsel and defendant to Court's questions.  Court finds defendant freely, knowingly and voluntarily waives his right to a preliminary hearing and binds the defendant over. 
Attorney Pruden acknowledged receipt of the Information, waived reading and plead not guilty to all charges on behalf of his client.
Speedy reserved.
Status conference scheduled for August 5, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Adj. 2:04PM
State's Motion for Sanctions
Larry Pruden
Larry Pruden

Defendant in court in custody via video with atty Jason Daane for Uzowulu. ADA Herrmann appears for the State of Wisconsin. SPD has conflict and need to appoint new counsel. Prelim was requested to be heard within time limits. Deft is waiving time limits. State request OT be paid by SPD. State to file motion on the matter.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 1, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
